**myTAI** unlocks statistically-informed analysis of evolutionary signals hidden in the gene expression data (transcriptome)
</p>

<br/><br/>

<br/><br/>

<br/><br/>

```{r message = FALSE, fig.height=3, fig.width=4, fig.alt="plot_signature_output", dev.args = list(bg = 'transparent'), fig.align='center'}
library(myTAI)
# obtain an example phylo-expression object
data("example_phyex_set")
# plot away!
myTAI::plot_signature(example_phyex_set)  
```

<p style="font-family: 'Fira Mono', monospace; font-size: 1.5rem;">
Initially inspired by the need to statistically evaluate the 'molecular hourglass' pattern that linked transcriptome evolution to 19th-century embryo studies, the original myTAI package has since evolved to facilitate fast and robust analysis of *any* transcriptome evolution patterns, from embryo development^[some early studies include [Kalinka et al. (2010) Nature](https://www.nature.com/articles/nature09634), [Domazet-Lo≈°o & Tautz (2010) Nature](https://www.nature.com/articles/nature09632), [Quint et al. (2012) Nature](https://www.nature.com/articles/nature11394)] to cancer progression and drug perturbation experiments.
</p>
